issue.title: Make st.map use light or dark styles based on Streamlit's theme

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body: ## üìö Context As described in #3362: > _For st.map and PyDeck it's not as easy to make them follow the exact theme, but we could at least make them use [the dark map](https://deckgl.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gallery/grid_layer.html) style when the app is show in Streamlit's dark theme with no overrides._ This PR sets the [mapbox map style](https://docs.mapbox.com/api/maps/styles/#mapbox-styles) (either `light` or `dark`) for st.map to that of Streamlit's active theme from the frontend when the user doesn't specify a `map_style`. The theme is injected on the frontend using the `withTheme` hook based on the luminance of the background color. - What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [x] Feature ## üß† Description of Changes - If the user specifies a `map_style` in the pydeck object, we respect their choice and don't overwrite the map style on the frontend - If `map_style` is unset: on the frontend, we set the map style URI to either mapbox://styles/mapbox/light-v9 or mapbox://styles/mapbox/dark-v9, based on the active Streamlit theme. - Uses the active theme from the frontend because we currently do not have the info in the backend on which theme is selected. See #5009. - [x] This is a visible (user-facing) change ### Demo: ![map-theme](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20672874/182371569-d0c18347-db41-494b-b8d7-63bea35c5444.gif) ## üß™ Testing Done - [x] Screenshots included - [x] Added/Updated unit tests - [x] Added/Updated e2e tests ## üåê References - **Issue**: Closes #3362 --- **Contribution License Agreement** By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

# Update

Hey all, just wanted to give a quick update for everyone watching. We definitely want to support this at some point but don't have a concrete timeline at the moment since it's a bit more complicated as Lukas mentioned. Please keep upvoting, then it's more likely we'll prioritize!

[From the forum](https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/check-if-the-app-is-in-dark-mode-or-light-mode-at-runtime/20222/5)

> EDIT: If one is comfortable using streamlit_javascript then this code will return the user‚Äôs system preference on load. So if light/dark mode is forced in streamlit it will still return system preference and neither will toggling it in system settings adjust the value dynamically but only on browser load, ie a browser refresh must be forced. Just tried on Mac and will try on Windows tomorrow.


```python
from streamlit_javascript import st_javascript
return_value = st_javascript("""function darkMode(i){return (window.matchMedia && window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches)}(1)""")
st.write(return_value)
```

issue.title: Provide mechanism to inspect current page theme within script

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Problem

I'm trying to dynamically fetch the current theme (as in, the colors and fonts it provides) in order to properly style visuals created from an external source without creating multiple copies of the same page, as is done in the demo. However, I could find not a good way to grab these visuals.

### Solution

**MVP:** Provide a function returning the theme, possibly as a dictionary containing the theme with appropriate key mappings

**Possible additions:** Instead of a dictionary of key-value pairs, return a mutable theme object, which can be modified with changes reflected in real time. For instance, if playing an album, this theme object could be modified to make the page match the album cover.

---

Community voting on feature requests enables the Streamlit team to understand which features are most important to our users.

**If you'd like the Streamlit team to prioritize this feature request, please use the üëç (thumbs up emoji) reaction in response to the initial post.**

body:
I created a component to get the active theme of the Streamlit app. To install it, run the command:

``` bash
pip install st-theme
```

Here is a basic example of usage:

```python
import streamlit as st
from streamlit_theme import st_theme
theme = st_theme()
st.write(theme)
```

And its output:

![st_theme_1](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/assets/41839984/ceb6dce9-fe11-4e40-a500-d2860ef61754)
[**[App]**](https://st-theme-1.streamlit.app/) [**[Source]**](https://github.com/gabrieltempass/streamlit-theme/blob/main/examples/st_theme_1.py)

However, I still believe that a native solution from the Streamlit Team is needed. Since this component has some limitations, as it is explained in the Parameters, Notes and Requirements sections from the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/gabrieltempass/streamlit-theme). So I upvoted this issue.

issue.body:
### Description

*style_metric_cards* does not display values when the dark mode is enabled, hiding the metric, delta and help options from the default *st.metric* method. I tested in three different browsers, with both dark and white mode, and got the same results in all of them: for the white theme, works fine, but has a bug when dark mode is enabled.

![Captura de tela de 2024-04-17 21-37-02](https://github.com/arnaudmiribel/streamlit-extras/assets/83557508/6fde5c9d-67b7-493e-a291-57e583be89f8)

### Reproduction steps

```bash
1. Apply style_metric_cards function to the code
2. create the metrics with st.metric
3. load the page with streamlit run file.py
4. notice the bug
```

### Logs

_No response_

### Version of streamlit

streamlit==1.33.0

### Version of streamlit-extras

streamlit-extras==0.4.2
